text:
Hi! All

I am a new user of Portable Thunderbird and I would like to seek help from fellow users, who are more experienced, to solve a problem.

I think I should explain it first. I usually get my mails by POP using Thunderbird installed in my machine (Mine is a Gmail account). But I would like to use Portable Thunderbird at the Cybercafe where I usually surf the Web. According to the instructions given on the Portable Thunderbird website, I copy my profile from my machine into the profile folder of Thunderbird in my USB. At Cybercafe, I use the portable exe to download my mail by POP while surfing at the same time. When I get back to my place, I copy the profile in the USB into my machine again.

The problem is that the amount of my saved mails are daily growing larger. It is no problem in the machine but a real problem in the USB.

Is there anyway to remove mails saved in the profile of the Portable Thunderbird in my USB, and yet manage to use POP? I needn't keep them there.

cheers!

PDT

text:
PDT wrote:

 > The problem is that the amount of my saved mails are daily growing
 > larger. It is no problem in the machine but a real problem in the USB.
 >
 > Is there anyway to remove mails saved in the profile of the Portable
 > Thunderbird in my USB, and yet manage to use POP? I needn't keep them
 > there.

PDT,

You have a couple of options.  You can selectively copy over bits of your mail store.  If you look inside your profile directory, you'll see individual directories and files that correspond to your mail folders. What you could do is create an Archive folder (for easy identification) and keep all your older mail you don't want to take with you inside that.  Then, copy all your mail folders over except that one (and sub-folders).  It's actually just a big bunch of text files, so you can really do what you'd like with them.

Also, you should compact your folders on a regular basis to save space.   Deleted messages are not removed until you do... even if you empty trash.  Just click on any Local Folder and then select FILE and then Compact Folders from the main menu.

Regards,
John

Hello,

I'm trying to install Thunderbird for Windows and Linux on my USB Stick and share my profile between them.
As it seems not to be possible to use the same profile folder for both Linux and Windows (as there are system specific components in it) it is necessary to have two profile folders and to create symbolic links for the mail folder, the address book and so on.
The problem is: with Linux it is not possible to create symbolic links as the USB Stick uses the VFAT file system; Windows links can be created but Thunderbird does not except them (i.e. no mails appear in Thunderbird).
Is there any possibility to circumvent these problems?

Regards
Carsten Scharfenberg
